Description: Papyrus (incomplete on the right side) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (6 ll.) and names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Receipt given by a husband to his wife for her dowry. Date year and name of King lost. (Ptolemy Epiphanes?). Origin Fayum".
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Like its partner (EA 10560), this object was previously erroneously recorded in the British Museum database as coming from the predominantly predynastic site of 'el-Girza', rather than 'Darb el-Gerza/Philadelphia' as is indicated by the published articles and provenance records.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (44490) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/44490)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bloom, loss, fractured, delaminating, spots, abraded, fragile Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth (loose) Object Priority: C Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: D Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
Acquisition notes: Purchased from M. Nahman. Cf. the additional sheets at the end of Thompson's MS Catalogue, titled "B.M. Nahman Papyri (1923)".
